newsitem.title: FRANCE: ONIC to revise up wheat carry-over estimate.
newsitem.headline: ONIC to revise up wheat carry-over estimate.

text.p: France's ONIC grain office is expected to revise upwards its forecast for soft wheat carryover stocks at end June 1997, grain industry sources said on Friday.
Figures drafted ahead of ONIC's next monthly grain report due for publication on Wednesday show carryover stocks of 2.510 million tonnes compared with a previous forecast of 2.268 million.
Last year's June 30 carryover was 2.204 million tonnes.
The figures can be fine-tuned by ONIC members ahead of release.

The draft figures suggest 1996/97 soft wheat exports to non-EU countries have been cut to 6.25 million tonnes from 6.30 million the previous month. ONIC also cut its target for soft wheat exports to other EU partners to 9.37 million tonnes from 9.42 million last month.

ONIC is also expected to revise total supplies after on-farm consumption to 33.19 million from 33 million, following an upward change in delivered harvest to 30.840 million tonnes from 30.660 million last month.
